item.title: Orzo salad
item.description:
repeated from a recipe blog I used to keep, from 2001.

A very simple orzo salad.

  • One pound orzo.
  • 1 pint-size tub green olives
  • 1 pint-size tub feta cheese
  • 2 bunches parsley

Cook the orzo and rinse with cold water to remove the starch and stop it from cooking. Pit the olives, reserving the juice they came in. (It is key to have good olives for this recipe - we get good ones at Whole Foods or (better) the food coop, "french provencal with herbs". Experiment.). Remove stems from the parsley. Chop the olives coarsely, and chop the parsely very fine. Crumble the feta. Get a big bowl, put in the ingredients (roughly) in layers or mix depending on your preference for mixed or layered. Take part of the reserved olive juice, add red wine vinegar, mix, and pour over the top.

Yum. I made two recipes of this over the weekend, and there's some left over, so it's time for a snack.
